job_description: Our Mission:Are you a motivated experienced person, used to working in an international multi-cultural environment, who really wants to make a difference in the open-source world? Are you looking for a role where you can really make an impact?At Open-Xchange, we decided to leave dead-end jobs where you don't make an impact and offer passionate experts the opportunity to be part of an international team that connects the world and millions of people by developing and delivering open-source technologies.We believe it’s crucial to work in an environment where people feel valued, are energized by their work and deliver added value – not only to colleagues, but also to everyone using our products.So this is what you get at Open-Xchange:You’ll learn from experts and increase proficiency by sharing your knowledge and profiting from theirs.You’ll work with colleagues from all over the world, so connecting people is not only our vision, it’s the way we work.You'll use open-source technology and play your part in the fight against big, dominant companies to keep the internet open.You'll work in a company with the whole tech stack.Does that sound like the working environment for you? If so, please get in touch and we can start the discussion.Many experts feel trapped in their job and don't think they can make a difference; however, that’s simply not true – everyone can make a difference!Be ready to shape your personal future, and the future of millions of people.Join us in our fight for an open internet and deliver added value! All you need to do is get in touch, so click the ‘apply now’ button, fill the form and be in contact.Team info:You will be part of the Sales Engineering team. Together with your team members, you'll act as a technical subject matter expert for our products and related components and take part in interesting projects.Our tech stack:LinuxDocker and KubernetesOpenStackEmail technologies (SMTP, IMAP, POP, TLS, LDAP, etc.)Your new job:You will act as Technical Sales Support for Open-Xchange solutions for our customers.You will manage the technical relationship with key OX customer throughout the entire presales cycle.You will investigate customer needs and pain points and find OX solutions.You will evaluate customer environments, create custom integration concepts, install and manage POCs, and write SOWs for actual implementations.You will manage architecture, design, and documentation for customer solutions.You will collaborate with the product teams to build technical presentations for customer and industry events.Your background:You already have customer-facing experience presenting and demonstrating complex technical products and solutions in an easy-to-understand way – ideally with email or related products.You have experience working on systems architecture and solution design with other technical subject matter experts.You are experienced in Linux-based environments.You have a good understanding of TCP/IP protocol stack, Routing/Switching algorithms and Security and Authentication Mechanisms.You can confidently communicate in English (both verbally and written).You are motivated and creative and want to connect the world through Open-Source technology.This is what you get at Open-Xchange:The possibility to work full or part time wherever you want in accordance with your needs.Flexible working hours that allow you to successfully combine your home and family responsibilities with work.Stay up to date with latest tech, by working on modern cloud software in an international team.Sharing thoughts is part of our DNA so expect Workshops and Team Events.We can discuss further location-related benefits together in an initial talk (e.g. company bike, company sports, digital meal vouchers, company pension scheme).Join the team:Join us in our fight for an open internet and deliver added value! All you need to do is get in touch, so click the ‘apply now’ button, fill the form and be in contact.Your contact person:Reach out to Justin from the People Team. He will be able to discuss current opportunities and tell you more about our exciting vision and mission @OX.Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, PermanentWork Location: Remote

Create customer value.

We believe that business growth starts with a fantastic product that people want to use. And with Publitas, we aim to create an exceptional experience for shoppers by publishing inspirational catalogs online. We also give our customers, leading retailers such as Mattel, IKEA, Home Depot, and Williams Sonoma, the personalized service they deserve, which has earned us their trust and loyalty. As a result, we have more than 1700 passionate customers and advocates worldwide.

Are you experienced in troubleshooting, monitoring, integrating, configuring, and administering SaaS applications or platforms? If yes, then this position might be for you. The person in this role will be an important part of the blood flow of the company with ensuring implementations, design, and maintenance is consistent with Publitas goals, industry best practices, and regulatory requirements.

You will be joining an Operations team consisting of an Operations Lead and a DevOps Engineer.

Responsibilities:

You will be ensuring that our SaaS toolset configurations, integrations, and access privileges are set according to our business needs and conform with our ISO27001 policies

You will execute and optimize processes related to infrastructure and tools used for collaboration, development as well as for our production service

You will ensure that the processes and tasks you are executing are conforming with our security standards and practices

You will support the work of other teams regarding IT-related questions, including but not limited to questions about our collaboration systems, our production infrastructure as well as our security (3rd line)

You will support the team to keep the documentation of our infrastructure, architecture, and processes intact and improve them continuously

You will maintain configuration guidelines, maintenance guides, internal handbook articles and other concerned documents

You will deploy infrastructure, applications, upgrades in accordance with our release management process

You will provide reports extracted from our product and customer data and ensure data availability to other teams

You will monitor the platform health proactively and will follow up, mitigate and resolve incidents that may occur

You will be implementing configurations and improvements of our monitoring components as well as introducing new components

You will be providing inputs and can participate in the review process required for our regular internal and external security audits
Requirements
A demonstrated Linux server administration knowledge (Debian/Ubuntu preferred)

A clear picture of how IaaS platforms such as AWS, GCP work

Experience with SaaS/Cloud tools such as or similar to (but not limited to) Google Workspace, Github, Slack, Zendesk, Geckboard, etc.

A good understanding of how SaaS environments and tools work and you actually like to administer a wide SaaS toolset

Experiences with current basic security solutions (SSO, 2FA)

Experience with writing basic SQL queries or willingness to learn

Basic but solid TCP/IP knowledge

Good collaboration skills and ability to multitask

An up to date knowledge about the current (SaaS) cloud infrastructure industry standards and trends

Fluent in English
Bonus:

You are familiar with the ISO 27001 standard, GDPR and CCPA

You have used PostgreSQL before

You can read and understand Ruby and Python code (Big+)

You have experience with infrastructure as a code
If you’ve been reading this far, chances are high you're a bit like us:

You desire to do things better and to improve the world around you.

You believe that results and impact matter more than hours spent.

You are self-driven, and you love the fact that Publitas operates through values & habits such as:

Honesty

Respect

Passion

Generosity

Excellence

Curiosity
What can you expect from us?

€31.200 - €56.650 gross salary per year. Salaries are assessed based on your relevant experience, level of seniority, and location.

Twenty-five vacation days per year and your National Holidays off.

A contract of indefinite duration.

Work from anywhere you desire.

A monthly shared office space/coworking allowance.

A one-time home office setup stipend.

A top-of-the-line MacBook.

Monthly wellness allowance to stay healthy while working remotely.

Annual retreats in some of the greatest cities in the world.

Free books in Kindle and Audible store.

We'll challenge and support you to get the most out of your potential through personal coaching sessions.

Please also have a read through our Recruitment FAQ
We promise to get rid of everything that stands in your way so you can create your best work. If this sounds like your kind of place, it’s time to get in touch.

Please feel free to contact our Recruitment team at careers@publitas.com if you have any questions.

Are you a Cloud Solution Architect who knows how to shape complex cloud projects from the scratch? And do you also like to get hands-on involvement when it comes to implementation and optimization? Or do you have a lot of experience in development and implementation and are ready to apply your skills and experience on a strategic level as well?
If this unique blended wiring sounds like you, then Mindcurv just might be the perfect place for you. We are a family-type, global company of tech consultants and executors with a rare DNA. Highly qualified experts who successfully handle challenging, hyper innovative IT-projects. From the very first discovery, till the project go-live and beyond. We are not the typical system integrator, and not the regular consultancy either. We do both. We do it simultaneously. And we do it as a team!
For us, being truly happy at work means loving our jobs, making an impact in projects, being held high for who you are, and having the opportunity to learn and grow. And that’s exactly what we offer you.
The setting
Within our Cloud Platforms Solution Line, we apply an agile approach to provide true on-demand cloud computing. We implement and operate secure cloud and hybrid global infrastructures using automation techniques for our clients business critical application landscape.
Your role
As a Mindcurv Cloud Solutions Architect you identify your customer’s business strategy and make sure we design and deliver the best fit solution. You’ll lead discovery sessions, translate them into technical solutions, and lead the tech team. Of course, all in close collaboration with client teams and colleagues.
What will you bring?
You are experienced in the above mentioned role, have already gathered extensive experience in cloud environments or bring an infrastructure background and the wish to expand your knowledge to the cloud
You already architected and implemented successful digital projects in Cloud or hybrid infrastructures
Performing in a customer facing context, preferably in eBusiness, was part of your daily business
You have experience with at least one of the three hyperscalers (AWS, Azure or GCP)
You have experience in working with development teams and are familiar with agile software delivery methods for web applications
Integration experience with complex heterogeneous systems environments
Experience with Service Oriented Architectures and Microservices
You aren’t a powerpoint architect ;-) You own your solutions, work with our clients and support our teams to see them properly implemented
What do we offer you?
Perks, like drinks and snacks, pizza sessions, gaming nights and sensational parties, a pension scheme and a great salary, we’ve got them all.
And if you crave an intellectual challenge, Mindcurv has you covered. Interesting projects involving the latest, hyper innovative tech. An agile, entrepreneurial environment, with lots of freedom and no politics. Work-life balance, a culture of transparency and a management team with their ears to the ground.
As we typically are the trailblazers and innovators, we’re working Remote First. A hybrid way of working in which you can work from home. You just come into one of our offices in Essen, Cologne, Düsseldorf, Munich, Frankfurt a.M., Hamburg, Jena, Utrecht, Madrid, Cochin, Coimbatore or Trivandrum when it adds value to be on-site. Looking for a glance behind the scenes? Check this blog.
Our high performers
You know who really thrive with us? Self-starters, team-players and continuous learners, with an uncanny ability to handle ambiguity. We’ll equip you with everything you need to succeed, help you explore the length and breadth of your domain and provide you with constant growth opportunities, to enrich your career.
Ready for change?
Are you ready for the next step in your career? For a role in which you can be fully yourself and bring out the best? In yourself, your colleagues and your clients? Don’t wait any longer and apply for this job right now.
About Mindcurv
At Mindcurv, we shape the future of digital. We help our customers rethink their digital business, experiences, and technology to navigate the new digital reality. By designing sustainable and accountable solutions for humans living in a digital world. By taking ownership, being proactive and pragmatic.

job_titles: Security analist | Tot 85k per jaar | Leaseauto | Kritieke infrastructuren | Onbeperkt studiebudget
job_description:
Organisatie

Dit bedrijf een van de meest gecertificeerde zelfstandige Cloudsourcing- en IT-securitybedrijf van Nederland. Al een kwart eeuw leveren ze hoogwaardige technologie-oplossingen aan klanten in onder meer de zorg, publieke sector en financiële wereld. Zo bieden ze betrouwbaarheid en veiligheid op de momenten die er echt toe doen.

Dat doen ze door samen met de klanten de slimste en meest betrouwbare Cloud architecturen voor hun bedrijf kritische toepassingen te ontwerpen, implementeren, realiseren en onderhouden. En daarvoor stellen zij alles in het werk. Want als ze niet alert zijn, gaan operaties in ziekenhuizen niet door of kan de koopakte van een huis niet gepasseerd worden.


Functie

Als Security Analist binnen het Cyber Defense Center (CDC) ben jij verantwoordelijk voor de functionele inrichting en de monitoring van de SIEM. Samen met je collega’s ga jij aan de slag om met behulp van onze SIEM/SOC oplossing klant omgevingen te monitoren. Met jouw kennis en interesse op het gebied van security zorg jij dat de klanten niet voor verassingen komen te staan.

Je dagelijkse werkzaamheden bestaan uit het identificeren en oppakken van (mogelijke) security incidenten, waarbij je het incident onderzoekt, de impact bepaalt en communiceert met klanten én collega’s om tot een passende oplossing te komen. Daarnaast ga je aan de slag met de onboarding van nieuwe klanten, waarbij je je met name richt op het finetunen en optimaliseren van use cases, zodat deze naadloos aansluiten bij de klantbehoefte en te monitoren infrastructuur. Ook help je mee aan de ontwikkeling van nieuwe use cases, als blijkt dat dit nodig is om te kunnen voldoen aan de klantbehoefte.

Het detecteren, beoordelen en afhandelen van complexe security events/incidenten;
Analyseren en onderzoeken van (mogelijke) security incidenten;
Klanten en stakeholders adviseren naar aanleiding van security incidenten;
Actief zoeken (hunten) naar mogelijk dreigingen in de klant omgevingen;
Het samen bouwen aan de professionalisering en uitbreiding van het CDC, waarbij er veel eigen inbreng verwacht wordt;
Het ontwikkelen en optimaliseren van use cases voor nieuwe en bestaande klanten;


Eisen
HBO werk/denkniveau
Aantoonbare affiniteit met security, bij voorkeur werkervaring binnen de IT Security sector;
Ervaring met het monitoren/analyseren van logs;
Sterk analytisch vermogen;


Voorwaarden
Salaris tot 85k
Leaseauto of mobiliteitsbudget
Winstdeling
Onbeperkt studiebudget
Pensioenregeling
Laptop en iphone
25 vakantiedagen
Mogelijkheid om te sporten in de fitnessruimte
Verse lunch
Mogelijkheid om thuis te werken


Heeft dit je interesse gewekt? Neem dan contact op met Jurrian van Gerwen

 +31 (0)6 – 82044075
 jurrian@layer.nl

Overview
As Intern – Project Management, you will support in digitalising the process from Order to Delivery and hand-over to Operations,
Reporting to the Senior Manager Project Portfolio, you will be a part of the Delivery Practice team inside the Technology & Engineering business unit for the Passenger Portfolio,
Are you ready to be part of the future?

What you will do
Finalize the due diligence on the existing Delivery process
Agree on a project charter and scope (order types, products, operating teams) of the digitalization
Build target Project Management/ Delivery process by using various tools to capture the order, initiate the delivery and track the project.

Propose the project schedule
Contribute to the definition of the target IT architecture.

Contribute to the assessment of the target data model and referential data
Work on IT business requirements on each digitalisation step expected
Prepare documentation for the hand-over to operations.

Work with IT on testing before involving end users
The process will be based on existing tools like Azure DEVOPS, ServiceNow, PowerBI, PowerAutomate, LogIO
Qualifications
Who you are
Project Management Master Students / Interns conducting Master Thesis

Team player
Attention to detail and strong organiser
What we offer

SITA’s workplace is all about diversity: many different countries and cultures are represented in our workforce, and colleagues who’ve been working here for decades collaborate with those just out of college and early in their careers. SITA is a place of change and constant improvement, where we're always pushing ourselves to find better ways of doing things: smarter, quicker, easier, for us and our customers and for their customers too.

And we offer all the good stuff you’d expect like holidays, bonus, flexible benefits, medical policy, pension plan and access to world class learning.
Welcome to SITA

SITA is the world’s leading specialist in air transport communications and information technology. We don’t just connect the global aviation industry. We apply decades of experience and expertise to address almost every core business, operational, baggage, and passenger process in air transport.
We design, build, and support technology solutions all with one vision to create easy air travel every step of the way. As an organization, we cover 95% of all international air travel destinations and work with over 2,800 air transport and government customers in every corner of the globe. Are you ready to explore the opportunities?
Keywords: Intern, Azure, ServiceNow, Power BI

Junior SAS ArchitectAre you the enthusiastic and motivated Junior SAS Architect we are looking for? Do you feel at home in a dynamic IT consultancy world? Do you want to advice and guide our clients in the process of choosing, designing, and implementing the best SAS software solution for them? Then OCS Consulting has the perfect job for you!What we doOCS Consulting is a leading SAS consultancy with offices in the Netherlands, the UK, Belgium, and Switzerland, with clients around Europe, and is looking to recruit a permanent Junior SAS Architect based in the Netherlands. We deliver a range of services from SAS Consulting Services, SAS Environment Support and SAS Software Reseller for our corporate clients.What you will doYou will work with independently as well as with our team of experienced SAS Solution Architects to propose, design, and implement SAS software solutions for our clients. You will work directly with our clients and their various stakeholders. In our ambition to maintain long lasting relationships with our client's quality is our top priority – and thus should be yours too!Your main responsibilities are:Collecting user requirements and convert them into and solution designsManaging your own projects and working with other projects to ensure timely deliveryLearning about the latest development in SAS, cloud solutions and Kubernetes, and understanding how they interactSupporting our Sales and Account Managers in pre-sales and identifying new opportunitiesWhat we are looking forYou have experience with IT and affinity with SAS. You have the ambition to learn and to be or become the best in class. Having some experience with administrating, deploying, or migrating software (SAS or otherwise), or providing IT consultancy services, would be advantageous.Our requirements are:2-5 years of IT experience1-3 years of SAS administration, installation, migration, or architectureAmbition to keep up with latest technological developmentsDelivery and solution orientedExcellent communication in EnglishOur ideal candidates also have one or more of the following:Experience with KubernetesExperience with clouds (e.g. Azure)Experience with pre-sales or project managementExperience from professional services or consultancyExperience from life sciences or the pharmaceutical industryAdvanced level of communication in Dutch, French or GermanExperience with BI/ETL/data analysis/statistics tooling other than SASExperience with developing code and/or reports (with or without SAS)Affinity with software salesConfident presentation and pitching skillsComfortable when working autonomously and within a team environmentIn return we can offer:Join a company that values long-term relationships with staff, clients and partners. All our relationships are based on a partnership model of collaboration, trust and respect. Our employees are vital to our success and we aim to attract the best people who will stay and grow with us. Furthermore we offer:A competitive salary with 8% holiday allowance24-28 leave days, with option to buy 13 moreReimbursement of travel costsParticipation in the company’s pension schemeOpportunities to progress, both in terms of skills and experience for the motivated and talented individual.ApplyIf you want to be part of our experienced team, if you want to thrive in a challenging environment of collaboration and flexibility, if you are eager to learn new skills to achieve your full potential and if you are a team player, then OCS Consulting is the right company for you!No agencies please!Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, PermanentPart-time hours: 32 per weekSalary: €3,500.00 - €5,000.00 per monthApplication Question(s):Are you willing to relocate to the Netherlands (when living outside of the Netherlands)?Experience:SAS administration, installation, migration, or architecture: 2 years (Required)IT: 3 years (Required)Work authorization:Nederland (Preferred)Work Location: Hybrid remote in 5222 AT Den Bosch

ROLE

The Data Solutions Architect resides within the Service Design & Delivery area of the EMEA Services Delivery function, specifically within the Consulting team.

The Data Solutions Architect, a domain architect, is a specialist with deep knowledge and niche expertise in the field of Data services and acts a supporting role to the Enterprise Solutions Architect. They are responsible for leading the technical presales of the Data Modernisation Offering, and drive the strategy, performance, and growth of the EMEA App & Data services practice by working closely with the Technology Lead, Practice Manager, local Sales leadership teams, and wider EMEA Services function.

ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE & EXPERIENCE

Previous experience working in a Presales, consulting, and or technical architecture role
High level of written and spoken English & Dutch
Ability to work both independently and within teams, including leading teammates in virtual teams, with a focus on our culture and values
Experience of design and implementation of data warehousing solutions on cloud platforms -specifically data ingestion, integration, and transformation; reporting applications; custom analytics; data migration from on-prem to cloud infrastructure; cloud storage architecture
Self-motivated with the ability to prioritise, meet deadlines, and manage sometimes quickly changing priorities
Hands on and in-depth experience of Cloud systems from a Data Architecture/Data Engineer perspective experience in Data Integration patterns and the design of AI/ML data solutions using notable services
Previous experience consulting to external clients on complex projects, and ability to shape complex solutions and assure high quality on the delivery side
Ability to analyse current practices, processes and procedures as well as identify future opportunities for leveraging Microsoft Azure Data & Analytics PaaS Services
Experience working with global teams on projects and working with offshore teams to facilitate project work
Advanced skills in analysing, designing, developing, implementing, and maintaining Big Data, AI, and Analytics systems
Experience of communicating and presenting complex information to technical and non-technical stakeholders, both verbally and in written form
Experience of exposing data to end users using PowerBI, Azure API Apps or any other modern visualization platform or experience
Experience of communicating and presenting complex information to technical and non-technical stakeholders, both verbally and in written form

KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Act as the ‘Data Platform expert’ and lead technical solution development with clients, partners, and external communities for new presales Data Modernisation development opportunities.
Work closely with Insight’s sales teams to develop and execute selling strategies and direct large proposal efforts by leading virtual teams and collaborating with local and global resources.
Support presales and business development activities to take shape by communicating proposed solutions with client executives and architects, interact with senior programme/client architects where required.
Seek to understand and evaluate clients business needs and industry trends in depth in order to develop trusted advisory relationships with clients and align solutions based upon Insight’s key differentiators.
Define and execute the Proof of Concept (POC) to demonstrate the value of the Data solution to the client.
Assess the clients knowledge of the Data Platform and overall Cloud readiness to support clients through a structured learning plan and ensure its successful delivery through partners.
Gather and analyse requirements from large, complex client environments and perform research and investigation activities to identify and create thorough, accurate technical solution proposals.
Assess and define the Data architecture principles with the client, also develop and implement the client-approved solution.
Design conceptual architectural and technical solutions; direct efforts toward defining technical, operational and user requirements including high-level design, statements of work, service design, and bills of materials.
Design and build modern data pipelines, data streams, and data service APIs, also deliver architectures for transformations and modernisations of enterprise data solutions using Azure Cloud Data technologies.
Support with the planning and implementation of data design services, provide sizing and configuration assistance, and perform needs assessments where required.
Develop data warehouse schematics, layouts, architectures, and relational/non-relational databases for Data Access and Advanced Analytics.
Prepare cost estimates for Data Platform solutions including professional and managed services, licensing, and hardware.
Manage and review the work of teams across all phases of the project (Plan, Build and Manage) in one or more projects, ensure offshore resources are utilised and leveraged appropriately, and project quality meets standards through the KPI identification and testing plan.
Own partnership with cross-functional technology and design teams to ensure consistent, beneficial client interaction and solution delivery.
Proactively deliver strategic messages and roadmaps to new and existing clients and lead client workshops and requirements discovery sessions, as well as building relationships with opportunity channel partners to enable collaboration.
Support with business value assessment and business case development and provide solution fit assessments against the clients requirements.
Contribute to sales effectiveness by identifying issues that may need to be addressed, provide information and commentary pertinent to deliberations, recommend options and courses of action, and implement directives.
Maintain and advance deep technical skills and knowledge, keep up to date with market trends and competitive insights, and share knowledge and best practice within the technical community.
Act as technical ‘point of escalation’ during the delivery of the data implementation project.
Contribute to the EMEA Data Modernisation Offering and standardisation as the technical ‘Data expert.’
Make recommendations to the design authority in order to create new standards based on any bespoke solutions created during a sales engagement.
Maintain close relationships with the standards development function and provide input in to the into the development of standards, architectural governance, design patterns and best practices.

This list is not exhaustive, you will be required to undertake additional responsibilities as reasonably requested by your manager.


ABOUT INSIGHT

We believe that by giving you the freedom to think big and empower you to reach your full potential, together we will achieve the best outcomes. Along with excellent benefits and a compelling reward package, we offer the opportunity to work in a supportive environment with a high level of autonomy and creativity - there’s a reason our average employee tenure is over 6 years.

We strive to display our three core values of Hunger, Heart and Harmony every day. They represent and drive who we are here at Insight and by doing so we are doing amazing things. Insight started in a garage in 1988 and it is through harnessing our three core values that two brothers, Eric and Tim Crown, steered Insight to the Fortune 500 company it is today. We are now a Global IT Services and Solutions business, passionate about helping customers and the real people who sit behind them.

APPLICATION DETAILS

Insight is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to achieving diversity and equality within our organisation. We seek out people from diverse backgrounds and encourage you to apply.

We will endeavour to contact you within five business days, should we feel your profile is a good match for this role. If you do not hear from us within this timeframe, please presume that on this occasion, your application was not successful.

A full job description will be provided upon application.

Keywords: Intern, Azure, ServiceNow, Power BI

At [1] Avanade, we believe in doing what matters and making a genuine human impact in everything we do. We transform businesses and help our clients envision new paths forward; we uncover ways technology can improve the way we work and live; and provide opportunities for our people to leave the world better than we found it.

For more than two decades, we’ve tapped into the power of our people and cutting-edge Microsoft technology to deliver business-critical technology capabilities to thousands of organizations around the world. Our deep expertise and relentless commitment to client success is the reason we are Microsoft’s #1 global partner. We’re also driven by an innovative spirit and a growth mindset, and we value leaders who can bring the best out in our people and nurture their careers while inspiring excellence for our clients and one another.

Are you a non-Microsoft Cloud Architect looking for a move into Azure? Or are you an Azure Developer or Administrator who wants to become an Architect? If so, join us and we will train you! Our European Azure Architect Academy is a program designed to give you the unique opportunity to upskill your capabilities in the Microsoft environment and to give you the skills, knowledge, and certifications to become an Azure Architect. We are looking for people who have a passion for creating value for our clients and doing exceptional work.

As an Azure Specialist at Avanade, you will make a genuine human impact with your cloud knowledge and skills and contribute to some of the largest and most complex client business problems with Azure. You will engage in solutioning and delivering exciting projects for interesting clients. You will also collaborate with colleagues from around the world on designing and implementing Azure solutions and architectures for clients. We will work with you to determine and achieve your unique version of success. Come and be the strategic technologist you’ve always wanted to be!

Collaboration is at the heart of our culture and the way we work. Our approach is shaped around the business and IT priorities and based on the latest thinking about cloud and data-driven solutions, intelligent automation, and technology services. We also provide market-leading learning opportunities for you to develop your career further. This comes in various forms including online courses, certifications, and external training.

Are you unsure if you meet all the qualifications but are deeply excited about the role? We encourage you to apply! This program is scheduled to start in early September 2023!

About the Role:
A well-designed cloud architecture will help enterprises to reduce costs and enable them to create a reliable and scalable IT infrastructure. This solid infrastructure is the basis on which we design and build complex cloud solutions that allow our clients to drive business value.

As a Microsoft Cloud Specialist, you will be a technical advisor for your clients and will support their digital transformation journey.

You Will Also:

Learn and work with experienced Avanade Azure professionals and become part of an active and growing Azure Expert Community
Work with a supportive team who will help you with questions and challenges
Use the latest Microsoft technology to make a daily difference for our clients
Work with a Career Advisor to create a plan and guide you in choosing from the many training opportunities we offer
Keep an eye on the future by being aware of emerging technologies in the application development landscape as well as the latest tools and techniques to deliver at scale

Our Ideal Candidate Has:

Worked in or solutioned in a multi-cloud environment
Implemented and potentially designed cloud solutions driving positive business outcomes
A passion for technology and a willingness to learn more
Clear, persuasive, and empathetic communication skills
Experience working with containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes, Pivotal Cloud Foundry, Container, etc.)

What We Offer:
Together we go beyond. At Avanade, we continuously invest in the development of your skills. We help you keep up to speed with the latest in technology and business and be a part of an international environment. As part of a growing organization, you get to grow too. The direction in which you want to grow is up to you!

We provide training to grow your skills, as well as interpersonal and management training and coaching from a more senior leader who acts as your career advisor.

Besides an exciting international environment, a unique chance to participate in challenging projects across Europe and interaction with inspiring colleagues who have a professional attitude and attach considerable importance to teamwork.

A diverse environment where respect for our clients, our teams, and the world around us is at the heart of everything we do. Together we do what matters.

Being a part of a supportive team of world-class experts at Microsoft’s largest partner.

37928BR
NETHERLANDS - Eindhoven, NETHERLANDS - Netherlands
Job Description and Requirements
System Design Engineer

You will be part of an R&D team developing 32Gbps NRZ and 64-112Gbps PAM4 serial-link (SerDes) transceivers. We are looking for an engineer with theoretical knowledge and practical experience to join our team. You will work with a cross-functional team of analog and digital designers, and hardware engineers.

You will be involved in all stages of development including:
Modelling: updating and maintaining SerDes system models
Sign-off: running system simulations to verify design performance across multiple protocols and channels
Silicon: correlating simulated performance with silicon measurements
Customers: assisting customers with system-level performance issues

You have an M.Sc. or Ph.D. in Electrical or Computer Engineering.

Due to the cross disciplinary nature of this position, key qualifications include one or more of the following:
Modelling - experience modeling circuits and systems in MATLAB/Simulink
Analog – experience designing high-speed analog CMOS circuits
Digital – experience with DSP
Communications theory – experience with equalization, coding, noise/crosstalk filtering

Beneficial Experience:
Experience analyzing link budgets for NRZ and/or PAM4 high-speed serial links
Experience modelling of SERDES transmitters and receivers in MATLAB or similar tool
Knowledge of circuit topologies used in high-speed SerDes Tx/Rx
Knowledge of Tx/Rx equalization techniques
Knowledge of CDR architectures and CDR loop dynamics
Knowledge of common high-speed serial data protocols including PCIe, 10G/25G/56G/112G Ethernet, JESD204C, CPRI
Experience with lab tests for high-speed serial links
Experience with C/Verilog-A/systemVerilog
Our Silicon IP business is all about integrating more capabilities into an SoC—faster. We offer the world’s broadest portfolio of silicon IP—predesigned blocks of logic, memory, interfaces, analog, security, and embedded processors. All to help customers integrate more capabilities. Meet unique performance, power, and size requirements of their target applications. And get differentiated products to market quickly with reduced risk.

At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you.

Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Engineering
Country
Netherlands

job_titles: Video Technology Consultant – Telecom Media & Entertainment
job_description:
Since 1993, EPAM Systems, Inc. (NYSE: EPAM) has leveraged its advanced software engineering heritage to become the foremost global digital transformation services provider – leading the industry in digital and physical product development and digital platform engineering services. Through its innovative strategy; integrated advisory, consulting, and design capabilities; and unique 'Engineering DNA,' EPAM's globally deployed hybrid teams help make the future real for clients and communities around the world by powering better enterprise, education and health platforms that connect people, optimize experiences, and improve people's lives. In 2021, EPAM was added to the S&P 500 and included among the list of Forbes Global 2000 companies.

Selected by Newsweek as a 2021 and 2022 Most Loved Workplace, EPAM's global multi-disciplinary teams serve customers in more than 50 countries across six continents. As a recognized leader, EPAM is listed among the top 15 companies in Information Technology Services on the Fortune 1000 and ranked four times as the top IT services company on Fortune's 100 Fastest Growing Companies list. EPAM is also listed among Ad Age's top 25 World's Largest Agency Companies for three consecutive years, and Consulting Magazine named EPAM Continuum a top 20 Fastest Growing Firm.

Learn more at www.epam.com and follow EPAM on Twitter and LinkedIn.

DESCRIPTION


EPAM is growing rapidly, and we are looking to expand our consulting expertise with more subject matter experts aligned to the media and entertainment domain to meet the ever-expanding demand from our client base.

You would become part of and help shape a newly formed team, responsible for defining and performing specialised entertainment video solutions related consultancy within EPAM and our client base. As a multifaceted individual you may play multiple roles that included client facing subject matter expert, pre and post sales systems architect, systems integration, strategic thought leadership and industry representative.

WHAT YOU’LL DO
Deliver Value for EPAM Clients by advising and enabling client technology leaders to positively affect business outcomes – having the ability to set and drive direction on existing, new, and emerging technologies to evolving business and operating models
Architect and Sell Value-Added Solutions
Work with sales and account management leadership to target clients
Engage with clients to understand their strategic challenge(s) and architect viable and value-added solutions that result in measurable business benefit
Identify and help achieving additional business opportunities
Conduct industry and technology insights that contribute towards GTM strategy for the telco media and entertainment business unit
Provide strategic direction towards scalable and agile architectures
Conduct research on new technologies and trends to develop internal competency
Define the enterprise level architecture and service design across Technology, IT, Supply Chain, Core & Access domains
Technical leadership for the E2E design of new features and platforms
Production of end-to-end High Level Solution Architecture
Contribute to Technology roadmap artifact and initiative
Lead technology blueprint creation as a video solutions SME
WHAT YOU HAVE
Bachelor or MSc degree level in a relevant area, like: computer engineering, software design/development, telecommunications, etc
Fluent in English language with strong written, verbal, presentation & communication skills
At least 10 years of experiences in the telco, media, and entertainment sector, resulting in a significant industry understanding
At least 10 years of experience in architecture, design, development or system integration while building entertainment video applications/solutions
Excellent understanding about how technology is adopted to fit Business purposes, and ability to formulate organizational Technology Strategy
A subject matter expert on any given area of entertainment video solutions
Previous experience in developing or designing complex client-server systems, and a good understanding of both frontend and backend aspects and challenges
Knowledge of microservices architecture, design patterns and associated technology stacks
Knowledge of cloud technologies like IaaS, PaaS, serverless technologies and related emerging trends
Creative thinking (out of the box), and comfortable modelling complex systems, with high availability and performance requirements in mind
TECHNOLOGIES
A subject matter expert on any given area of entertainment video solutions and not limited to IPTV, OTT, Cable TV, DTT and DST
Previous experience in developing or designing complex client-server systems, and a good understanding of both frontend and backend aspects and challenges
Knowledge of microservices architecture, design patterns and associated technology stacks
Knowledge of cloud technologies like IaaS, PaaS, serverless technologies and related emerging trends
Good understanding of the DevOps practices, including continuous integration, continuous delivery, and its relation to agile methodologies and incremental development
Knowledge of XML and XML-related technologies, JSON, and modern Web standards (e.g. REST, HTML5 and WebRTC)
Experience in writing technical documentation for systems design/architecture specifications, including the use of UML, block diagrams, sequence diagrams, etc
Knowledge of Digital TV technologies, STB Middleware platforms and Video Delivery technologies that includes video encoding/transcoding, CAS, DRM, video back-ends, workflows, CMS, security services, CDN, ad insertion, broadband data, home networking, TV, VoD, and PVR
Exposure to and understanding of Internet, TCP/IP Systems and Protocols, and Unix based systems
Knowledge of CPE MW technology such as RDK or Android TV is also desirable
Creative thinking (out of the box), and comfortable modelling complex systems, with high availability and performance requirements in mind
WE OFFER
Competitive Compensation
26 paid holiday days
Commuting to work- costs reimbursement
Pension Plan scheme
Discretionary Performance Based bonus
Laptop + Corporate Simcard + Corporate Mobile Device (subject to certain eligibility requirements)
Annual Salary Review
Trainings, Internal Education and Dutch Language Courses
Unlimited access to LinkedIn learning solutions
Relocation Package
Regular Corporate and Social Events
The opportunity to be part of a diverse and multicultural company
EPAM Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) (subject to certain eligibility requirements)
Certain benefits and perks may be subject to eligibility requirements

job_titles: Senior Consultant - PEGA CSSA - Amsterdam, NL
job_description:
Role: Senior Consultant
Technology : PEGA CSSA

Location: Amsterdam, NL
Business Unit: EAISBPM
Compensation: Competitive (including bonus)

Job Description:
Today, the corporate landscape is dynamic and the world ahead is full of possibilities! None of the amazing things we do at Infosys would be possible without an equally amazing culture, the environment where ideas can flourish and where you are empowered to move forward as far as your ideas will take you.

At Infosys, we assure that your career will never stand still, we will inspire you to build what’s next and we will navigate further together. Our journey of learnability, values and trusted relationships with our clients continue to be the cornerstones of our organization and these values are upheld only because of our people.

Your role:
As a Senior Consultant, you are an expert at contributing to different phases of the consulting lifecycle. You will be intensely involved in; you will define the problem, propose and refine the solution. You will also play an important role in the development, configuration and deployment of the overall solution. You will guide teams on project processes, deliverables and contribute to the proposal development, client training and internal capability-building and help detail the project scope. You will have the opportunity to shape value-adding consulting solutions that enable our clients to meet the changing needs of the global landscape.


Required:
Hands on experience in design, implementation, development and support of Pega PRPC v5.x/v6.x/v7.x and Pega frameworks. Should be Pega CSSA certified
Experience in either J2EE (JSP, Servlets, EJB, XML, Java), web development (JSP/Java script/CSS), .Net. Develops and demonstrates an advanced knowledge of the PRPC Architecture and all PRPC design and implementation features
Knowledge of PEGA PRPC V7.X architecture
Ability to translate business requirements into design/application builds
Critically reviews work of other team members
Analyzes, Identifies and logs enhancements/bugs for PEGA PRPC V7.X, V8.x.
Drives delivery of assigned tasks on schedule. Uses and promotes the use of Pega best practices and testing tools by working in an Agile-SCRUM based work environment.
Executes other responsibilities and key result

About Us

Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 46 countries to navigate their digital transformation.

With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.
“All aspects of employment at Infosys are based on merit, competence and performance. We are committed to embracing diversity and creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Infosys is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.”

job_titles: Afstudeerstage Analytics | Design an Automated Internship Process

job_description:
Your Impact
"Combine business development and (project) delivery with building relationships? As a Management Consultant you are responsible for one or more clients. This means substantively leading project and/or agile teams and determining and achieving deliverables. In addition, depending on your seniority, you are also responsible for customer relationship development. You play a major role in further expanding the success of the propositions, the Business Unit and Ordina as a whole. Customer focus and entrepreneurship are crucial here. You will work together with the customer, your own cross functional team and with the Sales & Delivery organization.



With our consultants within Digital Advisory & Transformation, we make the connection between our customer's digital transformation and Ordina's propositions and solutions, ensuring that our customers are not only ahead of the change, but more importantly stay ahead of it. Our consultants help shape our clients' digital transformation and, if necessary, bring it to fruition.




In doing so:

1. You operate at the forefront of the Ordina organization and help shape the consultancy practice.

2. You combine business development, (project) delivery and developing relationships at board level.

3. You have a lot of room for your own entrepreneurship, leadership and creativity in the execution of the role."



Where you're going to get started
Within the Strategy & Business Design team, we work hard to create a consultancy practice that adds value on both the business and IT side. The team consists of consultants with passion for the profession, each with his/her own area of expertise. Besides individual customer assignments, we work together a lot on developing consultancy services and crack challenging customer cases. A dynamic team where sharing knowledge and insights is a great thing.

This is you
"As a Management Consultant, you help organizations stay Ahead of Change in their market. You realize sustainable improvements and growth in business performance. You are able to advise organizations in developing innovative strategic organizational changes & transformations, set the right priorities, define the transformation roadmap and guide organizations through the transformation process.



With Ordina's propositions under your belt, you know how to generate assignments, advise (potential) clients on complex strategic issues and make an impact with practical, innovative solutions. In doing so, you are well able to connect Business and IT.



In addition, you have:
A WO degree in a technical or business administration direction
Proven track record in tactical and strategic organizational consulting at C-level
At least 10 years of experience as a consultant
Expertise within one or more of the following areas: Finance, Public, Utilities and/or Logistics
Content knowledge and experience within one of the following focus areas:

Agile transformation & scaling, DevOps transformation, workforce transformation, talent management, change management
IT strategy, cloud transformation, IT modernization, technology platforms, API/Composable Architectures
Data strategy, data driven organizations, data products, data platforms, data management & governance
Lean management, business process management, Obeya, portfolio management, growth mindset"

Benefits
Location independent & flexible working;
Unlimited development opportunities;
A laptop, phone & home office;
An attractive salary;
Choice between a company car or a mobility budget;
The ability to customize your own benefits through Flex Benefits:
Holiday pay & profit sharing;
27 days off (20 statutory and 7 in budget via Flex Benefits);
A pension plan, to which you are not required to contribute."


Everyone is welcome to apply. Because we believe in the power of diversity and value inclusion. After all, the best ideas and smartest solutions arise in diverse teams. That is exactly why we pay so much attention to the composition of our high performance teams. So that you feel at home and can get the best out of yourself.

Sr. Enterprise Data Architect - Director

About Booking.com

Established in 1996 in Amsterdam, Booking.com has grown from a small Dutch start-up to one of the largest ecommerce companies in the world. Booking.com is the largest business within Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) and accounts for the vast majority of Booking Holdings’ total revenue. Booking Holdings is a leading Fortune 500 e-commerce conglomerate with a market cap of approximately $80 billion. Booking.com currently employs approximately 10,000 employees in 140 offices in 70 countries worldwide.

With a mission to make it easier for everyone to experience the world, Booking.com invests in digital technology that helps take the friction out of travel. Booking.com connects travellers with the world’s largest selection of incredible places to stay, including everything from apartments, vacation homes, and family-run B&Bs to 5-star luxury resorts and even tree houses. The Booking.com website and mobile apps are available in over 40 languages and offer more than 28 million total reported accommodation listings, including over 6.2 million listings alone of homes, apartments and other unique places to stay. No matter where you want to go or what you want to do, Booking.com makes it easy and backs it all up with 24/7 customer support.

At Booking.com, we are all involved in making hundreds of decisions every day. The decisions we make are a reflection of our Values - they reflect what is important to us, both as individuals and as an organization.

When Values are made explicit, they provide clarity on what “good” looks like. And when they are shared, they build unity in a group. They build culture.


Think customer first. We obsess about adding value for our customers - guests, partners, colleagues - to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

Own it. We deliver on our promises, make informed decisions and prioritize to get the important things done today.

Learn forever. We are resilient, take time to reflect, and seek to learn – from colleagues, from the outside world and from our failures.

Succeed together. We celebrate team success, through making connections, building trust and valuing the diverse perspectives of others.

Do the right thing. We get the right results the right way. For each other, our communities and the world around us.


Booking.com continues to grow and expand its service offerings to customers, including the ‘Connected Trip’, Financial Services (FinTech) expansion in the United States and other exciting growth strategies.

Business Unit Central Tech

This business unit builds, maintains and continuously improves our technological foundation, which touches every single aspect of our business. These teams work together to ensure we collect data responsibly, use it effectively, and stay on top of the latest trends and techniques. From ensuring robust user privacy practices to growing machine learning innovations to making sure every device that connects us is 100% cybersecure, this business unit takes on a lot of responsibility. Central Tech at Booking.com is a critical enabler of the Booking.com overall mission towards the connected trip.

Profile Sr Enterprise Data Architect - Director

Booking.com's main company strategy, the Connected Trip vision is being spearheaded through connected data and we need a Sr Enterprise Data Architect that matches our ambitions.

As Booking.com continues down our data modernization journey, the Enterprise Data Architect is responsible for setting the strategy for Booking.com's data architecture, providing technical architecture direction for delivery of the Connected Trip. You will have an impact on the overall technology strategy by capturing the physical enterprise data model, working with the Data Management Office to align to the conceptual and logical models and will bring together all the Business Units and Departments data.

You will report to the Chief Data Officer at Booking.com and work closely with act as a data ambassador in BU discussions; collaborating cross functionally and working closely with our technology departments. You are an SME in enterprise data architecture, architecture policy and data domain taxonomy modeling.

The role is located in Amsterdam, The Netherlands; global HQ.

Responsibilities:

You will be responsible for:

Data Architecture

Capturing the physical enterprise data model, working with the Data Management Office to align to the conceptual and logical models

Setting the strategy for data architecture to support the Business and IT strategies and maintaining the data architecture principles

Creating the data architecture documents and templates for change initiatives and supporting solution architects to complete

Software Systems Design

Evaluate possible architecture solutions by taking into account cost, business requirements, technology requirements and emerging technologies and is the go to person on this topic for the area.

Describe the implications of changing an existing system or adding a new system to a specific area, by having a broad, high-level understanding of the infrastructure and architecture of our systems and is the go to person on this topic for the area.

Help grow the business and/or accelerate software development by applying engineering techniques (e.g. prototyping, spiking and vendor evaluation) and standards and is the go to person on this topic for the area.

Meet business needs by designing solutions that meet current requirements and are adaptable for future enhancements and is the go to person on this topic for the area.

Building software applications

Build software applications by using relevant development languages and applying knowledge of systems, services and tools appropriate for the business area and is the go to person on this topic for the area.

Write readable and reusable code by applying standard patterns and using standard libraries and is the go to person on this topic for the area.

Refactor and simplify code by introducing design patterns when necessary and is the go to person on this topic for the area.

Ensure the quality of the application by following standard testing techniques and methods that adhere to the test strategy and is the go to person on this topic for the area.

Maintain data security, integrity and quality by effectively following company standards and best practices and is the go to person on this topic for the area.

End to End System Ownership

Own a service end to end by actively monitoring application health and performance, setting and monitoring relevant metrics and acting accordingly when violated and is the go to person on this topic for the area.

Reduce business continuity risks and bus factor by applying state-of-the-art practices and tools, and writing the appropriate documentation such as runbooks and OpDocs and is the go to person on this topic for the area.

Reduce risk and obtain customer feedback by using continuous delivery and experimentation frameworks and is the go to person on this topic for the area.

Independently manage an application or service by working through deployment and operations in production and is the go to person on this topic for the area.

Continuous Quality and Process Improvement

Identify opportunities for process, system and structural improvements (i.e performance gains) by examining and evaluating current process flows, methods and standards and guide more junior members of the team in this topic.

Design and implement relevant improvements by defining adapted/new process flows, standards, and practices that enable business performance and guide more junior members of the team in this topic.

Ideal experience:

You are a technical leader and strategist involved in key business initiatives that impact the entire enterprise coverage.

You own the technical architecture and lead high level projects to the hands on implementation of the most challenging parts whilst coaching Principals and other technical talent.

You play an advisory role for the Tech Executive Leadership Team, and monitor the latest technology trends

You are co-accountable for the high-level decisions made in their area and are expected to have deep technical understanding of our technology stack, infrastructure and organization.

You will be an integral member of the Architecture group and will be responsible for the design and implementation of the enterprise wide data strategy, ensuring the strategy supports the current and future business needs.

You will apply knowledge of good architecture practice, architecture documentation and data technologies to comprehensively capture the current state holistic data architecture and oversee target state design and implementation.

You will collaborate with the Business, Data Management Office and internal and external IT stakeholders at all levels to ensure the enterprise data strategy and associated implementation is adding value to the business.

You are an effective communicator


Other personal characteristics:

Highly results oriented. Proven ability to prioritize initiatives to align to business goals; able to successfully navigate within a fast-paced environment handling multiple priorities.

Strategic thinking, vision, pragmatic execution with structure

Driving change and transformation, complex results at scale

Inclusive humble leadership style

Translate tech/ innovation into business

Implementation into the broader organization. Getting things done.
Pre-Employment Screening:

If your application is successful, your personal data may be used for a pre-employment screening check by a third party as permitted by applicable law. Depending on the vacancy and applicable law, a pre-employment screening may include employment history, education and other information (such as media information) that may be necessary for determining your qualifications and suitability for the position.

Are you a great team player, super creative and do you have a good eye for detail? Are you ready to be challenged, and challenge us? Then look no further because we might have a match!
‍
We are Bizzdesign, the world’s leading enterprise architecture platform recognized by Gartner. We help clients build structural “change muscle” and dramatically increase the success rate of enterprise transformation, IT & strategic investment allocation, and risk management. We provide a full future-proof solution that addresses the challenges of the largest organizations. We have customers in various industries ranging from the Dutch Tax Authority, Germany Police, and the British Ministry of Defence (MOD) to Desjardins, Schaeffler Technologies, Shell, Disney, Stanford Healthcare, NatWest Bank, and T-Mobile.

We have Dutch roots and a diverse geographically dispersed international workforce in The Netherlands, Germany, the United Kingdom, the United States of America, Canada, and Australia.

Our company culture is motivating and progressive. We’re dedicated to building meaningful relationships with each other and creating an inclusive workplace for everyone.

Our team is composed of international and passionate experts who are always there to help you. We have a down-to-earth “roll up your sleeves and get things done” attitude with a flexible, high personal impact work environment defined by high integrity, low-ego problem solving, and effective teamwork.

What impact will you make?

As a UI Designer at Bizzdesign, you will operate as a member of the product development division. You will work closely with our User Experience (UX) designer to create and implement an intuitive user interface. You will collect, research, evaluate and investigate user requirements.

Why is this role for you?

You get energy from collaborating with product management and engineering to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals, and experience.
You don’t give up until you’re done executing all visual design stages from concepts to final hand-off to engineering.
You are passionate about conceptualizing an original idea that brings simplicity and user-friendliness to complex design roadblocks.
You love creating wireframes, storyboards, user & process flows and site maps to communicate interaction and design ideas effectively.
You are an expert at translating requirements into style guides, design systems, design patterns, and attractive user interfaces.
Testing for intuitivity and experience is your thing.
You enjoy developing technical and business requirements and always strive to deliver intuitive and user-centered solutions.
You are not afraid of presenting ideas, concepts, and design solutions to various stakeholders incorporating feedback into your designs.
Creating prototypes for new product ideas comes easily to you.
Nothing goes unnoticed because you always test new ideas before implementation.

What are we looking for?

You have a sense of ownership and pride in your performance and its impact on the company’s success.
You pay strong attention to detail and have a keen eye for aesthetics.
You can clearly articulate your ideas, designs, and suggestions.
You have excellent time-management skills and you are a real team player.
You have a bachelor's degree in a relevant field of study.
You have at least 2 years of work experience as a UI Designer.
You preferably have experience with Figma.
You are a critical thinker and have excellent problem-solving skills.
You are fluent in English (verbal and written).

What is in it for you?

Money = a good base salary + bonuses + 8% holiday allowance.
Travel reimbursement , NS Business Card, good pension scheme.
You will have 28 holiday days if you promise to come back to us.
We like to invest in the growth of our employees, so we offer a range of courses and training depending on what you need so you can get a little bit better every day you’re with us.
Fantastic working atmosphere with amazing colleagues who always put a smile on your face, epic Summer BBQs, and out-of-the-way team activities.
Working together in an international environment with colleagues from all over the globe.
There will always be room for your new ideas, suggestions, and initiatives, no matter how long you’ve been with us.
As times are changing, we embrace working hybrid. We enjoy getting together at the office at least 2 times per week. The rest? Feel free to work from anywhere you want, as long as you have good Internet to send memes on Teams.
Of course, we take care of each Bizzdesign employee, so you can have the ideal workplace at home. Plus, you will get a “Work from Home Allowance” each month to cover some of the expenses made for electricity, internet cable, food& beverages, or just to improve your home office.
We offer fresh fruits and drinks in our offices.
Last but not least, we offer extraordinarily good coffee and tea.

Are you ready to start building your future with us? Let’s meet up for a cup of coffee at our office or online if you prefer and see if we have a match!

For additional information about the role of UI Designer, please contact Maria Cotorceanu who is the Global Recruiter via m.cotorceanu@bizzdesign.com.
